website_summaries.verdict: Choose it if you want a pizzelle maker by a top brand and prefer a nonstick surface. The long warranty makes it that much more attractive.
pros: Nonstick surface doesn't require a lot of oil and is easy to clean

customer_reviews.title: Great iron!
customer_reviews.text: Great little iron - compact for easy storage - makes great pizzelles - plates are not removable for cleaning but I didn't think it was difficult to clean. The feet were broken when it arrived and the seller promptly responded and shipped me new feet immediately. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Gina Brown

customer_reviews.title: ... had a very very old making and was so sad when it died
customer_reviews.text: I had a very very old making and was so sad when it died, my son bought one from a popular company. Well it was to small,to think and, I hate it. So I found yours the closest to my old one and, I'm so very happy with it. Thanks a very happy cookie maker. Christmas isn't Christmas in our famil without pizzelles. 🎄😀Victoria
customer_reviews.author: Joe Simone

customer_reviews.title: Non-stick?  NOT
customer_reviews.text: This is the non-stick... this thing is a joke. Tried twice. This going back... as is! (Yes, I used oil on the top and bottom and the recipe has four sticks of butter)
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Knisley

customer_reviews.title: Great Puzzle Iron
customer_reviews.text: We made our Christmas Pizzles and they were great. Our old iron bit the dust after 30 years. This new iron made Pizzles in 30 seconds as opposed to 2 1/2 minutes! Light, pretty, delicate, and snow flake like cookies.....wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Back Row

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Love the iron. I just wish the steam wasn’t channeled toward the handle. I prefer very thin pizzelles, but I was unable to squeeze the handle long enough or tight enough do to the steam from the cookies baking.
customer_reviews.author: Francesca Anderson-Harris

customer_reviews.title: This is the most wonderful Pizzelle maker
customer_reviews.text: This is the most wonderful Pizzelle maker. So true to it's word. Cooks pizzells in 30 seconds.. I love it. A great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Wohlers

customer_reviews.title: iron is great, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My husbands family makes these cookies every year for christams, we live away from them so carry on the tradition with our boys and make the cookies ourselves, iron is great, easy to use, doesn't burn the cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Replaces the same model iron we have had for many, many years. Replacement iron appears as durable as the old one. Arrived as promised and packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Old Guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great iron and the Pizzelles come out nice and thin. Also comes with recipe book that has a couple different version of the cookie.
customer_reviews.author: Greg E.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We got this right before Christmas and spent several days making pizzelles. It not only made great pizzelles, but it provided great memories in making and delivering them. Best gift this year!!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Pizzelle iron
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. This was my first time making Pizzelles and they turned out great. Truly nonstick. Pizzelles took less time than recommended, done in about 45 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Walter A. Flenner

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Sticky
customer_reviews.text: It is a lie that this is called "non stick"
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great durable gadget.
customer_reviews.text: Heats very well and even. This is my favorite tool around Christmas..
customer_reviews.author: Baron

customer_reviews.title: Great iron!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, spray it well and they won’t stick came out perfect . Easiest to clean with stiff nylon bristle brush!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved this Pizzelle iron
customer_reviews.text: Loved this Pizzelle iron. Had just learned how to make Pizzelles by an elderly lady using her iron, so had to get my own. This iron is SO easy to use. Recommend it HIGHLY !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A well-received gift!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this pizzelle iron for our relatives who bake pizzelles at least once a week. Their old pizzelle iron had worn out from overuse, and this made a great gift. They love their new pizzelle iron and the new "cookies" have turned out delicious! Based upon their comments of use, I gave this product 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kamy K

customer_reviews.title: Pizzelle Maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Pizzelle Baker for my husband and he loves it. He has made Pizzelle's atleast 5 times since it arrived. They taste amazing. I recommend this product to anyone who knows what a Pizzelle is and wants to make them at home with ease.
customer_reviews.author: angeleyes8398

customer_reviews.title: Great product, made in America
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product because it was made in America. It delivered . The pizzelles were cooked evenly and we did not have a single one stick.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Natale

customer_reviews.title: THIN PIZZELLE MAKER
customer_reviews.text: The pizzelle Iron maker works well. The issue is my older one was much thinner and came from Italy. How can you compare when we are not matching apples to apples. Quality of the product is excellent, however, the iron is disappointing compared to the Italian Maker I owned from years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou Gwozdek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pizzelles
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research and settled on the Palmer. Cost a little more but lived up to its reputation. First batch all came out perfect. My wife uses a small cookie scoop to ensure using the same amount for each one and removes when they stop steaming. Not a one stuck and they cooked evenly which was important to me. Built solid like reviews stated. Has a great warranty too. .
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Nonstick Pizzelle Baker
customer_reviews.text: It gets very hot, very fast It's baking surface is smaller than usual It doesn't have a light to signify when the surface is hot enough to apply the batter It takes 30 seconds for the pizzelle batter to cook BUT - it was made in the USA and does not have "hot" spots This is the fourth pizzelle iron I've had in forty years - I'm keeping track
customer_reviews.author: Vicki O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer is terrible
customer_reviews.text: No return label, threatens return fee, among other threats. No way to back up your product. Return policy should be stated prior to sale, not after. Did I mention that it cost me $11.98 to send the machine back to vendor and from what I can see they never refunded Amazon the correct amount of money due them.
customer_reviews.author: Joan P. Pineau

customer_reviews.title: The BEST you can own.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Pizzelle Iron available today. I recently made 1,000 pizzelles and I will make another 2,000 to 3,000 before the end of the year. This machine is well made. The handles are long enough so you don't get burned from the steam. Even if you only make a few pizzelles, this is the machine you should have.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Lady

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: beThe 1st unit we bought worked fine but we noticed a defect in stick free coating after the initial use. We returned the unit and had the replacement in 3 days. The 2nd unit works great and has no defects. We are pleased with it. You have to pre-heat it for 15 minutes per operating instructions to insure proper temperature. Our previous unit had an indicator light that went off when at temp (not 15 minutes). This would be the only improvement I would suggest. It's better to know you are at temp. rather than guess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST PIZZELLE IRON ON THE MARKET!!
customer_reviews.text: This Teflon pizzelle iron is the best on the market. I own the Palmer electric stainless steel pizzelle iron but this nonstick Teflon iron blows it away. The pizzelles come out perfect every time and do not stick to the iron. I did own a Cuisinart pizzelle iron but that was a piece of junk of course made in China. And yes Palmer is made in America. You won’t be disappointed if you buy this product. Keep up the good work Palmer.
customer_reviews.author: Norman M.

customer_reviews.title: Best Pizzelle Iron on Market
customer_reviews.text: Nothing beats a Palmer pizzelle iron! This is my second one in many, many years. Quality and made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: my second one has the small pizzelles which I didn't like as much
customer_reviews.text: I have had two other pizzelle makers in my lifetime so far. My very first one died....my second one has the small pizzelles which I didn't like as much. I love this one. It's so easy to clean and the pizzelles seem to come out easier. I would recommend this one for sure!
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: Makes Great Pizzelles
customer_reviews.text: This is our third and by far the BEST Pizzelle iron we have purchased. The Pizzelles come out crispy and delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Wilde

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: Makes awesome Pizzelles. And best of all, the Palmer Irons are made in the good old USA
customer_reviews.author: Rix08

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Always throw the first couple out Lightly oil before you plug in Perfect pizzelles every time
customer_reviews.author: TSSGlass

customer_reviews.title: Works fast
customer_reviews.text: Like all similar appliances, the fist few will stick, but then all subsequent ones release easily. I would have given it 5 stars if it had a ready light.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: With using Pam cooking spray, this makes amazing pizelles!!! We found that 1 minute 10 sec was the perfect timing!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Palmer Non-Stick Pizzelle Iron
customer_reviews.text: This iron makes nice pizzelle - once it's treated with enough oil and thoroughly heated. It isn't totally non-stick. It seems sturdy and is fairly heavy but came out of the box with the lower handle loose. It doesn't have a signal light to indicate heating which would be nice (but not absolutely necessary)
customer_reviews.author: JDS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pizzelles
customer_reviews.text: Be patient; season the iron with oil first. There will be some sticking at first: but eventually you will not need to use the oil. My pizzelles stayed very crispy.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine H

customer_reviews.title: Great, Just Great..
customer_reviews.text: My mom made THE BEST Pizzelles. Her iron got lost when they moved. Bought this one based on reviews and made in USA. NO sticking issues for me. Cant decide whats worse of two evils: aluminum or Teflon. Opted for Teflon (cast iron would be great!). Followed recipe from included booklet. Worked great. (added Anise seed and extra Anise extract to batter) I want to experiment with a corn flour-based batter and also want to try Chocolate, banana, lemon, almond, and pistachio.. Minor issue: Screw that holds lower handle to iron was lose. Tightened and all is well. Fun to set up little production line..Wound up eating allot of the 'profits' :)
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was prompt and my mom's husband is very happy with this iron.
customer_reviews.author: B. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Besta pizzelle maker
customer_reviews.text: Great product,in fact,it is the best product on the market,I have used one for over 15 years,but just wanted to try the non stick version
customer_reviews.author: Celtic

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Fired it up and was knocking out pizelles in no time flat. Easy clean up. Took a couple of tries to figure out how much batter to use but otherwise, it rocks!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: It makes making pizzelles easy!
customer_reviews.text: We love it. Made ice cream cones for the first time too. The cookies are smaller than I'm used to with my mothers machine, but, the nonstick is wonderful and even the kids were making the cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Frank or Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Palmer 1000T Electric Pizzelle Iron-Non-Stick
customer_reviews.text: A very nice nice unit for sure. It didn't work when I received it but I repaired it myself easily. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R.

customer_reviews.title: NO STICKING!
customer_reviews.text: This pizzelle iron is awesome! From the very first pizzelle's...NO STICKING! Perfectly cooked every time! very impressed! My old pizzelle iron was a nightmare!
customer_reviews.author: N. SHAFER

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used the pizzelle maker and it worked great, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: charlotte pender

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one. The 1st one delivered was damaged. Even though it is suppose to be nonstick the cookies stuck to the iron. Returned it immediately and bought the CucinaPro. It's cheaper and better than Palmers.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed to find this product of exceptional quality. Very sturdy, nonstick, and a fancy pattern on top of product to boot!!
customer_reviews.author: CindyLouWho321

customer_reviews.title: I make Pizzelle often now!
customer_reviews.text: I have truly enjoyed this Pizzelle Baker. It does have to be sprayed with a non-stick spray for my recipes. If sprayed, I've found that I can simply use a toothpick to get the pizzelle loosened in one spot, then remove it very easily. I've made both savory and sweet pizzelle. I even used boxed sugar-free cake batter, added some spices, and it worked great for quick pizzelle.
customer_reviews.author: DesertLady

product_meta.title: Palmer 1000T Electric Pizzelle Iron-Non-Stick
product_meta.description: Made in USA This very popular iron is designed to make delicious crispy high ribbed 2 pizelles in half the time required by hand irons. Makes 2 thin 5\" cookies, 120v 800w, UL listed, Chrome and cast aluminum body, 10 year manufacturer's warranty (Palmer stipulates that you contact them directly for warranty repairs.)
feature_bullets: Made in USA by Palmer Manufacturing.
Made in USA by Palmer Manufacturing.
Made in USA by Palmer Manufacturing.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars81 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
